moves.6. Be3 Bg7 7. f3: This is my favorite line, the Yugoslav.
moves.7... O-O 8. Qd2 Nc6 9. Bc4 Bd7 10. O-O-O: This position looks fairly normal, doesn't it? White is supposed to play Bb3 here, but instead, he messes up.
moves.11. g4: g4?????? That was a huge error, thanks to blacks series of discovered attacks that put him into a winning game.
moves.11... Nxd4: Nxd4! Black now posts a discovered attack on the c4 bishop. White can't capture 12. Bxd4 like he wants to.
moves.12. Qxd4 Nxg4: That move gains a pawn, with a discovered attack on the queen. If 13.Qd3 then Ne5. If 13.Qd2 then Rxc4. If 13.Qd5 then Nxe3. Qxa7 wouldn't work either.
moves.13. Bxf7+: The best option, in my opinion.
moves.17. Kb1 Rc5: Trying to get the rook into the action.
moves.20... Be6: Be6! A huge threat, not stoppable unless...
moves.21. Rd5 Bxd5 22. exd5: White resigns here. He's down a whole rook. This game shows how one simple messup in the sicilian dragon can cost the game.
